snippet: The acquisition of Sikorsky would be the biggest by Lockheed since its $10 billion takeover of Martin Marietta in 1994.
abstract: Lockheed Martin has finalized agreement to acquire Sikorsky, which makes Black Hawk helicopters used by United States military, in deal that is said to be worth more than $8 billion; deal will be largest acquisition by Lockheed since its purchase of Martin Marietta for $10 billion 21 years ago.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: The acquisition of Sikorsky would be the biggest by Lockheed since its $10 billion takeover of Martin Marietta in 1994.

headline.main: Lockheed Is Said to Buy Maker of Black Hawk Helicopters
headline.print_headline: Lockheed Is Said to Buy Copter Maker
